description: From Latin galēna (“dross from smelting lead”), of unknown origin.

nouns.description: galena (usually uncountable, plural galenas or galenae)

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A mineral, lead sulphide (PbS), mined as an ore for lead. [From circa 1600.]
examples: You can easily extract lead from galena, a natural mineral which has been used in crystal radio receivers.

entries.meaning: (medicine, obsolete) A remedy or antidote for poison; theriac
